messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Thinking styles
messages.msgSnippet: LOL! I *knew* there was a reason unschooling fit so well !  ;)
messages.messageBody:
<<SandraDodd@... wrote:>>

<<Well...
The world itself?>>

LOL! I *knew* there was a reason unschooling fit so well ! ;)

<<I think trying to narrow it to a show or magazine or product is, again,
trying to focus an all-directions flow.>>

I'm not trying to narrow it down, I'm just looking for any additional suggestions to open it up some more. But I think I understand your point that, divergent thinkers especially, like to have lots of input to process and by trying to identify specific things, even those that "fit with their learning/thinking styles", you may be doing them a disservice by inadvertently narrowing down the flow.

<<With learning styles and thinking styles in mind, what I've always tried to
do is rather than try to analyze any one child, I just provide and keep
swirling through lots of means of input and experience for them--sound,
sight, smell, texture, taste.>>

Good point and that's definitely my goal. However, being a relative newbie, I sometimes wonder if I'm providing "enough" input and experience for them, especially when the more typical ones (homeschool field trips, outside "classes" etc.) are currently of no interest. So I'm always on the lookout for new "input", especially stuff I think they will enjoy.

Pam L.
